header.titleText: How well do you know your election week No 1s?

questions.question: Which pop crooner soundtracked the Conservative party’s second consecutive victory in the 1955 election?

multiChoiceAnswers.answer: Dickie Valentine Feat. The Stargazers - The Finger Of Suspicion

questions.question: 8 October 1959 marked a third win for the Conservative party, now led by Harold Macmillan. But which teen-pleasing single topped the charts this week?
October 1964 wasn’t just a triumph for the Labour party. Which very famous singer enjoyed one of five weeks at the top of the charts during this election week?

multiChoiceAnswers.answer: Anyone Who Had A Heart - Cilla Black
(There's) Always Something There To Remind Me - Sandie Shaw

questions.question: This broken hearted ballad spent two weeks at the top of the UK charts - one of which saw in Harold Wilson’s second election win in 1966. Can you name that hit?

multiChoiceAnswers.answer: Strangers In the Night - Frank Sinatra
You Don't Have to Say You Love Me - Dusty Springfield
The Sun Ain’t Gonna Shine Anymore - Walker Brothers

questions.question: It’s the summer of 1970. As the Conservative party regain power, what No 1 occupied the top spot for 7 weeks?

multiChoiceAnswers.answer: Spirit In The Sky - Norman Greenbaum
Bridge Over Troubled Water - Simon & Garfunkel

questions.question: During the first of two elections in 1974 - which single stomped its way to the top of the UK charts during the week of 28 February?
...The second of which took place on 10 October. Can you name the huge pop hit topping that week’s charts?

multiChoiceAnswers.answer: You're The First The Last My Everything - Barry White

questions.question: It’s 3 May 1979 and as Margaret Thatcher begins her reign. Which single was in the midsts of its six weeks at No 1?
As Thatcher’s hold on the country continued, which band swept the nation with this timeless ballad?
By 1987, Thatcher had lead the Conservative party into three successive election victories. But which other female(s) was soaring high this year?

multiChoiceAnswers.answer: I Wanna Dance With Somebody (Who Loves Me) - Whitney Houston

questions.question: It’s 1992 and John Major is now the Prime Minister of Britain. Which somber single spent eight weeks at the top of the charts during his inauguration?

multiChoiceAnswers.answer: End of the Road - Boyz II Men
I Will Always Love You - Whitney Houston

questions.question: Tony Blair wins the 1997 election. But which R&B hit was winning hearts that May?

multiChoiceAnswers.answer: I Believe I Can Fly - R Kelly
I'll Be Missing You - Puff Daddy & Faith Evans feat 112

questions.question: The chart mood shifts from earnest to upbeat in 2001. Which single was at No 1 during Blair’s “quiet landslide" in 2001?

multiChoiceAnswers.answer: Do You Really Like It - DJ Pied Piper & The Masters of Ceremonies
Can't Get You Out of My Head - Kylie Minogue

questions.question: Blair’s final victory was at the 2005 election and the charts were awash with novelty hits and tacky sentiment. Which of the following was at No 1 in May?

multiChoiceAnswers.answer: (Is This The Way To) Amarillo? - Tony Christie Feat Peter Kay

questions.question: David Cameron wins the 2010 election and Simon Cowell has the UK charts in a chokehold. Which reality star single was at No 1 during the Conservative’s 6 May election win?

multiChoiceAnswers.answer: Please Don't Let Me Go - Olly Murs

resultGroups.title: Very nice work indeed. You know you pop and politics as well as Farage knows his way around a pint of stout and a packet of Smiths Scampi Fries. Don’t get too ahead of yourself though - come back in four years and we’ll see how much you know about 2015’s current No 1, Omi’s Cheerleader (Felix Jaehn Remix).
resultGroups.share: I got  _/_ in the Guardian's election chart toppers quiz and it was a landslide success

resultGroups.title: You are almost great. But almost great is not great enough. Do you think Noel Gallagher would have shaken the hand of an almost great Tony Blair? No he wouldn’t. Do you think D:Ream would have affiliated themselves with the almost great New Labour? Probably. Try again for ultimate brilliance.
resultGroups.share: I got  _/_ in the Guardian's election chart toppers quiz and did pretty well

resultGroups.title: Low to average. Thatcher didn’t win votes through being low to average at politics, did she? Nor did Mungo Jerry secure 7 weeks at No 1 with his low to average summer smash In The Summertime. Scrub up on your pop and politics and try again.
resultGroups.share: I got  _/_ in the Guardian's election chart toppers quiz and scraped through

resultGroups.title: Oh dear. You need to scrub up on both your British politics and pop hits pronto. Go back to school. Or the library. Maybe take an evening course. Or just consult Wikipedia like a normal cheating modern day quizmaster.
resultGroups.share: I got  _/_ in the Guardian's election chart toppers quiz and it was a landslide failure
